alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Mingo; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Buchanan, northwestern McDowell, southeastern Mingo and west central Wyoming Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fedscreek, or 8 miles northeast of Breaks Interstate, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Paw Paw, Hinch, Big Rock, Gilbert Creek, Gilbert, Iaeger, Panther, Hurley, Hampden and Roseann. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
